free_text.Learning outcomes: [li] To understand the characteristics of integrated sensors; understand the interface between the integrated sensors and electronic circuits; and be able to treat and optimize an integrated combination of sensors and electronics as one system. [br/][br/][li] limits of the known and feasible in the field of integrated sensors and integrated electronic circuits by exploiting the potential of integrated sensors, miniaturization, and synergies of sensors and electronics.
free_text.Content: 1. Sensor effects and integrated sensors: a summary [br/]Electrical conductivity - resistive thermometer; PN and MS junctions - diode thermometer; Thermoelectric effect - thermopile; Piezoresistance effect - strain sensor; Electromagnetic induction - coil magnetic sensor; Galvanomagnetic effects - Hall magnetic sensor; Photo effect - photodiode; Surface field-effect - charge (chemical) sensor. Multi-sensor effects: thermo-stress-piezo-(resistance, Hall, ...)-effects. Noise and other parasitic effects.[br/][br/]2. Electronic models of integrated sensors[br/]Criteria for a good model. Examples: Model of a photo-diode; Model of a CMOS-integrated SPAD (single photon avalanche diode); Model of an integrated Hall plate.  [br/][br/]3. Sensor system[br/]Elements of the systems theory: function, components, attributes, relationships. Sensor system vs. Control system. Examples of the system approach to improve sensors: compensation, feed-back, chopping.[br/][br/]4. Integrated sensor systems[br/]Why integrating ? Pragmatic reasons. Quality reasons: from a change in quantity to a new quality; from integrating to merging. Examples of integrated sensor systems: multi-axis Hall magnetic sensor; SPAD array 3D image sensor; and a few other latest examples.[br/][br/]5. Using sensors to improve electronic systems[br/]Using sensor knowledge to minimize the parasitic sensor effects: improving device matching by avoiding the thermal, piezo-resistive and piezo-junction effects; application to the amplifiers and band-gap voltage references.[br/]Using sensors as diagnostic tools; example - piezo Hall effect for measuring the packaging stress. Incorporating sensors into integrated electronic systems - to monitor the chip temperature, to non-invasively monitor a current.
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic knowledge in semiconductor physics, sensors, and electronics
